author: Staff Reporter
text:
Chamber welcomes joint ventures

Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industry has welcomed joint ventures proposed between the railways and State governments. Its secretary D.R. Kodeeswaran said in a statement on Wednesday that their chamber had urged Chief Minister Jayalalithaa to initiate talks with the Railway Ministry to expedite projects such as new line from Thoothukudi to Madurai via Aruppukottai to spur economic growth in southern districts. Other states were getting a large number of railway projects. The railways was implementing joint venture projects with Kerala and Andhra Pradesh. In the recent past, it signed a memorandum of understanding with Odisha and Maharashtra.
title: Chamber looks forward to more railway projects under ‘new venture’ concept
